repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: Dolores Carrara was a radio actress and dnacer. This co;;ections include scripts from programs broadcasted on the radio station WGY and television station WRGB based in Schenectady, NY.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Born on Janaury 29, 1929, Dolores I. Carrara started dancing acting, and singing for radio stations at just three years old. Some of her first radio apperances at the WGY station in Schenectady, N.Y. included dancing for the shows "Children's Jamboree" and "Tell Me A Story." Carrara also did a Christmas Eve special for the WGY radio station in which she sang two songs that were broadcasted in South America. As she got older, Carrara also modeled for General Electics and was a regular actress on the "FBI in Action" WGY radio show.

Dolores I. Carrara also took dance lessons from Florence Sanford and eventually moved to Miami with her husband where she worked on shows for the WTVJ commerical radio. Eventually Carrara moved back to Schenectady, N.Y. and became a secretary at a local library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains scripts that Dolores I. Carrara used when starring in radio shows. Programs in the collection include episodes of Dear Chollie and The Ted Malone Show and an adaptation of Jane Eyre. The majority of radio scripts are episodes of The FBI in Action.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Dolores I. Carrara donated all items in 2004.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Dolores I. Carrara Papers, 1946-1947. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Taylor Papers).
